sentence1: But the ball, which wore a dress of morocco leather, and thought as much of herself as any other young lady, would not even condescend to reply.
sentence2: The next day came the little boy to whom the playthings belonged, and he painted the top red and yellow, and drove a brass-headed nail into the middle, so that while the top was spinning round it looked splendid.

sentence2: "Look at me," said the top to the ball.

sentence2: "I know very well where she is," sighed the top;

sentence1: "I know very well where she is," sighed the top;

sentence2: The more the top thought of this, the more he longed for the ball.
